rev.comment: It is unnecessary to repeat the non-free logos here when main articles are linked and the logos exist there. This is just fair use decoration, and fails [[WP:NFCC]] #8
rev.diff:
Line 10: Line 10:
== Post-NASL Revival (1986â87) ==
== Post-NASL Revival (1986â87) ==
â
[[Image:86erslogo.png|logo|thumb|right|Vancouver 86ers]]
 
{{Main|Vancouver 86ers}}
{{Main|Vancouver 86ers}}
â  
In 1986, a professional soccer team was again launched in Vancouver, the Vancouver 86ersâso named because of both the year of the team's founding and to commemorate the year Vancouver was founded (1886). The 86ers played in the [[Canadian Soccer League (1987â1992)|Canadian Soccer League]] (CSL) winning 4 straight CSL Championships (1988â1991) and 5 consecutive CSL regular-season first-place finishes (1988â92). In 1990, the Vancouver 86ers captured the North American Club Championship after defeating the [[Maryland Bays]] 3â2 in the final played in Burnaby. The game was played between the champions of the [[Canadian Soccer League (1987â1992)|Canadian Soccer League]] and the champions of the [[American Professional Soccer League]] (APSL). Vancouver played in the CSL from its inception in 1987 until the league folded in 1992, and then moved over to the APSL in 1993 which was later absorbed into the USL hierarchy of leagues in 1997 becoming the [[American Professional Soccer League|A-League]], later renamed the [[USL First Division|USL]].
In 1986, a professional soccer team was again launched in Vancouver, the Vancouver 86ersâso named because of both the year of the team's founding and to commemorate the year Vancouver was founded (1886). The 86ers played in the [[Canadian Soccer League (1987â1992)|Canadian Soccer League]] (CSL) winning 4 straight CSL Championships (1988â1991) and 5 consecutive CSL regular-season first-place finishes (1988â92). In 1990, the Vancouver 86ers captured the North American Club Championship after defeating the [[Maryland Bays]] 3â2 in the final played in Burnaby. The game was played between the champions of the [[Canadian Soccer League (1987â1992)|Canadian Soccer League]] and the champions of the [[American Professional Soccer League]] (APSL). Vancouver played in the CSL from its inception in 1987 until the league folded in 1992, and then moved over to the APSL in 1993 which was later absorbed into the USL hierarchy of leagues in 1997 becoming the [[American Professional Soccer League|A-League]], later renamed the [[USL First Division|USL]].
Line 24: Line 22:
{{See also|Vancouver Whitecaps FC}}
{{See also|Vancouver Whitecaps FC}}
â
[[File:Vancouver-Whitecaps-FC-Logo.svg|150px|logo|thumb|right|Vancouver Whitecaps USL]]
 
In 2001, the team began to use the old Vancouver Whitecaps moniker (signifying both the 'white caps' of the nearby mountains, and the waves of the [[Pacific Ocean]]). The Whitecaps currently practise on the new turf field at [[Simon Fraser University]].
In 2001, the team began to use the old Vancouver Whitecaps moniker (signifying both the 'white caps' of the nearby mountains, and the waves of the [[Pacific Ocean]]). The Whitecaps currently practise on the new turf field at [[Simon Fraser University]].
Line 45: Line 42:
{{See also|2011 Vancouver Whitecaps FC season}}
{{See also|2011 Vancouver Whitecaps FC season}}
â
[[File:WhitecapsFC.PNG|150px|logo|thumb|right|Vancouver Whitecaps MLS]]
 
The Vancouver franchise was granted status on March 18, 2009 by MLS Commissioner [[Don Garber]] as the seventeenth franchise of Major League Soccer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/content/mls-awards-vancouver-team-2011 |title=MLS awards Vancouver team for 2011 |date=2009-03-18 |accessdate=2010-10-17}}</ref> It is to join the [[Portland Timbers (MLS)|Portland Timbers]], announced two days later as the eighteenth MLS franchise, for the [[2011 Major League Soccer season|2011 MLS season]]. While no name was provided at the Vancouver announcement, over a year later the club confirmed that the MLS team would keep the Whitecaps name.<ref>{{cite news | title=It's official: Whitecaps joining MLS in 2011 | url=http://www.vancouversun.com/official+Whitecaps+joining+2011/1402528/story.html | publisher=[[The Vancouver Sun]] | date=2009-03-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title=MLS expected to announce Vancouver expansion team | url=http://www.cbc.ca/sports/soccer/story/2009/03/17/sp-whitecaps-expansion.html | publisher=[[CBC News]] | date=2009-03-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title=Whitecaps to announce they will join MLS in 2011 | url=http://www.vancouversun.com/Sports/Whitecaps+expected+announce+they+will+join+2011/1398865/story.html | publisher=[[The Vancouver Sun]] | date=2009-03-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | Whitecaps to announce MLS franchise secured | url=http://www.canada.com/Sports/Whitecaps+announce+franchise+secured/1399199/story.html | publisher=[[Canwest News Service]] | date=2009-03-17}}</ref>
The Vancouver franchise was granted status on March 18, 2009 by MLS Commissioner [[Don Garber]] as the seventeenth franchise of Major League Soccer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/content/mls-awards-vancouver-team-2011 |title=MLS awards Vancouver team for 2011 |date=2009-03-18 |accessdate=2010-10-17}}</ref> It is to join the [[Portland Timbers (MLS)|Portland Timbers]], announced two days later as the eighteenth MLS franchise, for the [[2011 Major League Soccer season|2011 MLS season]]. While no name was provided at the Vancouver announcement, over a year later the club confirmed that the MLS team would keep the Whitecaps name.<ref>{{cite news | title=It's official: Whitecaps joining MLS in 2011 | url=http://www.vancouversun.com/official+Whitecaps+joining+2011/1402528/story.html | publisher=[[The Vancouver Sun]] | date=2009-03-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title=MLS expected to announce Vancouver expansion team | url=http://www.cbc.ca/sports/soccer/story/2009/03/17/sp-whitecaps-expansion.html | publisher=[[CBC News]] | date=2009-03-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | title=Whitecaps to announce they will join MLS in 2011 | url=http://www.vancouversun.com/Sports/Whitecaps+expected+announce+they+will+join+2011/1398865/story.html | publisher=[[The Vancouver Sun]] | date=2009-03-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite news | Whitecaps to announce MLS franchise secured | url=http://www.canada.com/Sports/Whitecaps+announce+franchise+secured/1399199/story.html | publisher=[[Canwest News Service]] | date=2009-03-17}}</ref>
